Adaptations.description: Strengthening local capacities to deal with phenomena related to climate change and reduce the vulnerability of the habitants of La Paz Municipality on impacts on ecosystems, species and human livelihoods.
Adaptations.contact_adress: Colombia street Mariscal Santa Cruz corner, Técnico Municipal building, 4th floor, city of La Paz - Bolivia
Adaptations.source: Environmental Quality Management, Municipal Government of La Paz, www.ci-lapaz.gov.bo
Adaptations.initiating_agent: Honorable City Hall of La Paz
Adaptations.executing_agent: Local Government, Municipality of La Paz
Adaptations.success_factors: For institutional factors not implementation of adaptation measures in risk areas or sectors including agriculture, food safety, management of water resources, disaster risk management.
Adaptations.limiting_factors: Do not count on the government budget
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: The project will significantly reduce the adverse effects of climate change at the local level as a contribution to development and in benefit of the municipality of La Paz
Adaptations.comments: Assessments about Environmental Impact and Socio-Economics of Climate Change in the Municipality of La Paz will be carried out.

Adaptations.title: National Environmental Training Program
Adaptations.description: This program is part of the work that LIDEMA develops for 16 years and in the last five have been mainly the issue of climate change. It aims to carry out specialized training of its member institutions and different sectors of Bolivian society in sustainable development, to improve the capacity and skills of Bolivian professionals in the areas of environmental management and sustainable development, and carries out teacher training programmes on these topics with the help and participation of member institutions. To date there have been sensitized to more than 200,000 people through training processes including ante and ex post evaluations. About 10,000 teachers in the formal education system have been trained in climate change, which have replicated the contents with their students.
Adaptations.contact_person: Edwin Alvarado, League of Environmental Defense
Adaptations.contact_adress: Ecuador avenue Nº 2131, Sopocachi, city La Paz - Bolivia
Adaptations.initiating_agent: ONG Directors of the Environmental Defense League (LIDEMA)
Adaptations.executing_agent: National Coordinators Team of LIdema
Adaptations.success_factors: In rural areas it is necessary to strengthen institutional capacities
Adaptations.limiting_factors: The factor of population should increase their level of awareness of the effects of climate change, to implement appropriate local response actions
Adaptations.mitigation_synergies: With educational measures for afforestation and reforestation
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: With the development of various materials related to the saving of water resources, forestry activities and risk management processes to achieve training effects.
Adaptations.comments: Professors of the National Formal Education System have been trained in climate change, aiming to replicate the contents and processes to students.

Adaptations.title: Construction of a program to reduce the vulnerability of livelihoods
Adaptations.description: Development of diagnostic and capacity strengthening for the implementation of a national climate change adaptation program.
Adaptations.contact_adress: Ecuador avenue Nº 2131, Sopocachi , City of La Paz - Bolivia
Adaptations.initiating_agent: Directory of the League of Environmental Defense NGO (LIDEMA)
Adaptations.executing_agent: Consulting team and national coordinators of LIDEMA
Adaptations.success_factors: The institution must recruit a team of consultants in the short term so that the diagnosis is made and the construction of program to reduce the vulnerability of livelihoods.
Adaptations.limiting_factors: None
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: With the project, human resource capacities of LIDEMA and its allies will find themselves strengthened and ready to implement adaptation actions.
Adaptations.comments: LIDEMA associated network may develop throughout the national territory projects with measures to reduce the vulnerability of livelihoods.

Adaptations.title: Evaluation of tendencies in water balance as an indicator of climate change
Adaptations.description:
"The weather conditions that can be expected for mid-21st century are generated by General Circulation Models. However, these models have a thick resolution so the local variation is poorly simulated. Although this problem is global, the situation in Bolivia is more critical because of the physiographic features of the country that are generated by the many areas of life and unique ecosystems.
With the information generated from the project, maps of highly vulnerable zones can be generated. This is an important step for planning Adaptation."
Adaptations.contact_adress: Héroes del Acre street Nº 1850, Faculty of Agronomy (Ex asylum San Ramon). City of La Paz - Bolivia
Adaptations.source: Faculty of agronomy, IIAREN, Major University of San Andrés (UMSA), www.umsa.bo/fa/
Adaptations.initiating_agent: Ministry of Development Planning, National Climate Change Program
Adaptations.executing_agent: Faculty of Agronomy, Agricultural Research Institute and Natural Resources - IIAREN
Adaptations.success_factors: None
Adaptations.limiting_factors: The project did not have limiting factors, however the application of the results obtained by the investigation should be taken into account by national institutions for planning of a climate change response
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation:
"The project will determine the temperature variation of most areas of the country. Statistical magnitudes of sustained rainfall were variations were established.
Historical annual variations were analyzed in reference to evapotranspiration and impact suffering areas were identified."

Adaptations.title: Education, communication and research on adaptation to climate change
Adaptations.description: Pilot training, research and outreach on climate change adaptation in Guaraní culture communities of TCO of North Charagua Bolivian Chaco as a means to contribute to growth and diversification of household income.
Adaptations.contact_adress: Charagua Cordillera province, city of Santa Cruz - Bolivia
Adaptations.initiating_agent: Ministry of Development Planning - National Climate Change Program
Adaptations.executing_agent: Arakuaarenda Center Foundation
Adaptations.success_factors: It is important the municipal institutional role for the financial viability and implementation of adaptation measures.
Adaptations.limiting_factors: Initially little interest of locals families knowledge is gradually applying.
Adaptations.mitigation_synergies: With the addition of vegetation and fuel consumption reduction.
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: The project achieves awareness, training and technical training in agro-forestry and agricultural practices to adapt to climate change. Community outreach to build water reservoirs, gardens, research with a diagnosis of sources of water supply, consumption and irrigation, record droughts, use of soil resources, plant formation
Adaptations.comments: Communities of Guarani culture Charagua TCO northern Chaco Boliviano with tools to adapt to climate change.

Adaptations.title: Melting of Tuni Condoriri watershed and its impacts on water resources in the cities of La Paz and El Alto
Adaptations.description: To quantify the impact of climate change on Tuni-Condoriri glaciers system and evaluate the impact on the availability of water resources for drinking water supply for the city of El Alto and east and west sides of the city of La Paz.
Adaptations.contact_adress: 30th street of cota cota, University campus, city of La Paz - Bolivia
Adaptations.source: Project Report 2006/2007 Five-Year Plan, National Climate Change Program, www.mmaya.gob.bo
Adaptations.initiating_agent: Ministry of Development Planning, National Climate Change Program
Adaptations.executing_agent: Major University of San Andres - Institute of Hydraulics and Hydrology
Adaptations.funding_source: Netherlands Cooperation and the Institut Recherche Pour le Developpement (IRD)
Adaptations.success_factors: Essential collaboration and coordination in the institutional and financial entities involved in the project.
Adaptations.limiting_factors: Weather information from stations near the site
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: The project will quantify the impact on water management of water, energy and irrigation. The project also constitutes guidance for the submission of profiles adaptation projects under the Andean Regional Adaptation Project in Ecuador, Peru and Bolivia.
Adaptations.comments: There will be weather information processing and periodic gauging flow.

Adaptations.title: Observed climate change and natural disasters in Cochabamba
Adaptations.description: Analyze historical trends of climate parameters and the future impact of climate change in the city of Cochabamba.
Adaptations.contact_adress: Tadeo Haenke y Gabriel René Moreno streets, ciity of Cochabamba - Bolivia
Adaptations.source: Project Report 2006/2007 Five-Year Plan, National Climate Change Program, www.mmaya.gob.bo
Adaptations.initiating_agent: Ministry of Development Planning - National Climate Change Program
Adaptations.executing_agent: National Service of Meteorology and Hydrology Cochabamba
Adaptations.success_factors: There was no indication
Adaptations.limiting_factors: No limiting factors
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: The project strengthened the existing of meteorological network with the replacement and / or provision of new equipment and instrumentation. Climate of Cochabamba Zoning was developed. Characterization of aridity. Mapping of drought, rain occurrence of potential natural hazards, occurrence of frost.
Adaptations.comments: Maps of drought, rainfall events and occurrence of frost were made to develop adaptation strategies and plan.

Adaptations.query: Copacabana, Manco Kápac, La Paz - Bolivia
Adaptations.title: Planting dates and varieties of potatoes and beans as options for adaptation to Climate Change in the province Manco Kapac
Adaptations.description:
"This assessment identify and implement adaptation options to climate change through participatory and scientific research to contribute to food security and increase income of rural peasant communities.
The project will evaluate the agronomic performance of five varieties of potatoes and four ecotypes of beans sown at different sowing dates."
Adaptations.contact_adress: Héroes del Acre street Nº 1850, Agronomy Faculty (Ex asylum San Ramón). City of La Paz - Bolivia
Adaptations.source: Agronomy Faculty, Major University of San Andrés (UMSA), www.umsa.bo/fa/
Adaptations.initiating_agent: Ministry of Development Planning - National Climate Change Program
Adaptations.executing_agent: Faculty of Agronomy, Agricultural Research Institute and Natural Resources IIAREN
Adaptations.funding_source: Netherlands Cooperation - Faculty of Agricultural Engineering - UMSA
Adaptations.success_factors: A critical factor has been the environmental conditions affecting the researcher plots prepared for crops.
Adaptations.limiting_factors: Extreme weather like hail and frost affecting the implementation of the measures.
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: Integrated control of Chocolate Spot (Botrytis fabae) in beans crop

Adaptations.title: Participatory learning and community adaptation to climate change for food insecurity
Adaptations.description: The project aims to create an integrated and participatory learning capability and community adaptation strategies to climate change to reduce food insecurity in three communities in the municipality of Ancoraimes. It aims at generating an evaluation methodology on local damages, at revaluing the use of local or traditional knowledge of bio-indicators in agricultural and livestock production, and to scientifically bolster this information with data gathered in a local meteorological station. With this data, local decisions and agreements will be reached. The productive diversification will enable the families to have a more diverse alimentation, to conserve and sustainably manage soils through a system of integrated management of crops (MIC), using techniques such as rotation of crops, incorporation of solid and liquid fertilizers, handling of covers (alive and dead), all of this is harmony with agroforestry systems. Practices inspired in individual and communal experiences will be implemented, and results will be diffused through consciousness-raising sessions, peer to peer training among farmers and “learning by doing”, fairs and sharing of experiences.
Adaptations.contact_adress: 6 de Agosto avenue No. 2530, City of La Paz - Bolivia
Adaptations.source: Small Grants Prgram (PPD) - United Nations Development Program (PNUD), www.pnud.bo/ppd/
Adaptations.executing_agent: Plan Internacional Inc.
Adaptations.success_factors: Local strategies and biomarkers to manage communities should be compared with systematic information to anticipate likely damage to production systems, events exacerbated by climate change.
Adaptations.limiting_factors: Not have sufficient financial resources.
Adaptations.mitigation_synergies: Through the incorporation of agroforestry systems in integrated management and reforestation in degraded areas
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: The communities are able to manage local strategies and biomarkers compared with systematic information to anticipate likely damage to production systems events exacerbated by climate change. Families diversify agricultural production through the use of varieties and species that are adapted to local climatic conditions and practices of Integrated Crop Management (ICM) and agroforestry systems are applied. Children, adolescents and their families improve their knowledge and understanding on Adaptation to Climate Change, Resilience and Climate Risk.
Adaptations.comments: The concepts approved by CBA will receive small amounts for planning (<$2000) to make the necessary indicators’ evaluations to trace a base line that will be our reference, and plan and write –with the community- the detailed final proposal.

Adaptations.title: Setting up of protection systems for water sources and establishing soil conservation and management practices through reforestation
Adaptations.description: The project aims to reduce the vulnerability of water resources by implementing protection systems, soil management and conservation practices through reforestation in two regions. One is in the mountain range and the other in the plains in Municipio de Batallas. The Project will help firstly to restore a communal tree nursery located in the area of Huancané, improving its capacity to produce tree and shrub seedlings by 60%. This guaranties the tree and shrub supply for commercial purposes and other project requirements, such as the reforestation of areas located upstream of the water taking point (river basin), as well as to provide the reforested areas with filtration ditches and natural walls.
Adaptations.contact_adress: Héroes del Acre Street Nº 1850, Faculty of Agronomy (Ex asylum San Ramon). City of La Paz - Bolivia
Adaptations.source: Faculty of Agronomy - IIAREN - Major University of San Andrés (UMSA), www.fa.umsa.bo
Adaptations.executing_agent: Faculty of Agronomy, Major University of San Andrés
Adaptations.success_factors: Non achievement, due to institutional aspects (municipality), the rehabilitation of communal nursery and consequently failure to achieve the protection of sources.Management of financial resources by local authorities and producers, aimed at ensuring the sustainability of adaptation measures and mitigation project.
Adaptations.limiting_factors: No seedlings availability and consequently failure in the achievement of water sources protection to ensure its availability.
Adaptations.mitigation_synergies: Yes, by capturing carbon dioxide in the biomass of the forestry plantation.
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: The project has been improved and upgraded the productive capacity of forest nursery. Protected water sources. Headers forested watershed and soil conservation practices that increase the water infiltration in soils.
Adaptations.comments: During the planning phase and visits to the project area, the CBA Batallas Project was received by the community residents with interest, will, and commitment, and no opposition or unfavorable opinions that could later turn into obstacles were found.

Adaptations.title: Recovery of tarwi seed (Lupinus mutabilis S.) in four communities
Adaptations.description: "The project proposes a recovery and appreciation of the local seed of tarwi and its spreading in the Carabuco Municipality through the promotion of ecotype quality seeds, local varieties, as well as the experimentation with introduced varieties aiming at creating and valuing their comparative benefits regarding adaptation, performance and productivity; as well as training of environmental leaders. These local leaders will strengthen the existent productive organizations, individually and collectively, perfecting environmental and adaptation to climate change abilities through the carrying out of practices and knowledge transfers, accompanied by sharing of experiences and organizational strengthening, aspects that will allow for a better appropriation of the adaption measures of the community, as well as for the strengthening of local organizational capacities through the creation of an organization of environmental promoters and the spreading of the acquired experience in the municipal level that will improve the ability of the population of the Municipality to face adverse phenomena caused by climate change."
Adaptations.contact_adress: Estados Unidos Street § 1487 near Panamá corner, city of La Paz - Bolivia
Adaptations.source: Small Grants Program (PPD) - United Nations Program for Development (UNDP), www.pnud.bo/ppd/
Adaptations.executing_agent: ONG CUNA
Adaptations.success_factors: Extreme environmental conditions (cold) affecting the experimental plots for implemented seeds.
Adaptations.limiting_factors: A continuing research is needed to obtain certified seeds adapted to new weather conditions and technological improvements for crop production.
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: With the project, tarwi producers improve their productive and commercial capacities. A participatory research in experimental plots was implemented.Local capacities were developed in order to adapt to climate change through environmental promoters.
Adaptations.comments: "The selected indicators for the project are: 1. Promote the adaptation ability of the communities that depend on natural resources through consciousness-raising, a better access to information on the different possible scenarios and climate change, and a better access to alternative resources; 2. Promote sustainable community management of natural resources, to face climate change."

Adaptations.title: Sustainable management of water and soil: knowledge and tools to improve resilience to climate change and to reduce vulnerability
Adaptations.description: The objective of the project is the implementation of adaptation measures along with the community, preparing their members them to climate change effects. In this sense, with financial support from the CBA, we will help the people of the communities of Moro Moro, Alto Veladero (Vallegrande Province, City of Santa Cruz), to understand, prevent and improve their ability to adapt to the impacts of climate change and reduce their vulnerability, providing to Santa Cruz valleys our protection initiatives of environmental services. The project will focus on sustainable management of forest resources to protect native species, soils, and ecosystem services (flood, erosion, and landslide protection) from climate change risks. It will compliment baseline activities by reforesting key hydrological capture zones and areas at risk from increasing erosion pressures. The project will also directly target community awareness and adaptive capacity through an aggressive outreach and training component, while sharing lessons with neighboring municipalities.
Adaptations.contact_adress: Irala avenue § 421 Marinkovick Building - 2nd Floor, City of Santa Cruz, Bolivia
Adaptations.executing_agent: Natura Foundation
Adaptations.success_factors:
"- Possible governmental changes.
- Not development of an adequate process of understanding about prevention and improvement to the impacts of climate change and reduce vulnerability."
Adaptations.limiting_factors: No mentioned considering that the project is in fase of tasks implementation.
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: None
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: Local knowledge about the interrelation of natural resource use and changes in formal climatic factors (recovered, increased and revalued) to support municipal planning. Meteorological and hydrological monitoring system set (water quantity and quality). Water sources conservation systems as an environmental service due to climate change.
Adaptations.comments: Strategies such as participatory analysis of historical climate variability, formulation of a community plan for protecting key hydrological recharge zones, evaluation of potentials for involving private landholdings in adaptation measures, cabacity building workshops etc. were developed.

Adaptations.title: Community model of rural water and climate risk management
Adaptations.description: The objective of the project is to improve the availability of water for irrigation and human consumption among rural families in communities located in areas vulnerable to climate change in the Municipality of Vallegrande. The project will implement the Natural Heritage Reserves (Repano) which consists in the protection of water sources with closures to human and animal activity and which will be managed by local communities. It will also be implemented multi-irrigation systems that will allow water accumulation from low-flow water springs for supplemental irrigation during long periods without rainfalls saving agricultural production. This implicates the construction of 15 irrigation systems in 5 communities in the area of Alto Seco. Each system will store 1500 m3 of water, which will cover the water needs for irrigation purposes. These measures will be designed to allow for more intensive agriculture, reduce land degradation, and help to even-out annual patterns of water availability as rainfall declines and becomes more erratic.
Adaptations.contact_adress: Nuflo Chávez street § 1151 - city of Santa Cruz - Bolivia
Adaptations.executing_agent: Oriental Training Institute (ICO)
Adaptations.success_factors: Ensure adequate financial resources for the normal development of multifamilial irrigation system measures.
Adaptations.limiting_factors: Limiting factor of the project will be to not achieve the designation as Natural Heritage Reserve (Repana) of the areas around local water sources.
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: Local water catchment areas are protected and the vulnerability of local agriculture to current climate variability is reduced. The adaptive capacity of the community and local government is improved. Resilience of local water sources (through associated ecosystems) is improved in order to be able to resist pressures driven by climate change.
Adaptations.comments: For the effective implementation of the project, active participation of involved communities is needed. This will be reached through the assessment of the perceptions of climate change from the perspective of community members.
Adaptations.reviewer_comment: "Hello Lika, Thank you very much for improving the quality of these projects. Believe me; we are really happy about this. Okay, now some Comments about this project ;) Activities, which you are mentioned in the comment, belong to the description, in principle. In principle, these are the interesting activities which must be separated described in detail. But as we know from reality there is often not much information about the single activities. However, we want to separated ci:grasp from other project databases by focusing on activities/measures. There for it could be useful to split up projects with many activities into smaller parts dealing with the same aspect. These six activities are different, just look: Which project type would you choose for every single activity? I don’t think you will choose every time the same ;) And that’s the point: to big projects result in a to general description and evaluation. To cut a long story short, maybe you can focus on these multi-family irrigation systems and provide some more information about this. Then you can just mention in the comment that there are more activities done by this project (maybe a short list). If you have questions you can direct contact us via mail steffen.kriewald@pik-potsdam.de, tabea.lissner@pik-potsdam.de Cheers Steffen"

Adaptations.title: Sustainable management of natural resources in local communities
Adaptations.description:
"It is intended for families of the Municipality of Ocurí to improve and diversify the agro-ecological production through proper management of natural resources.
Peasant farmers apply improved technologies in soil resources, water and plant, as an option for climate change adaptation."
Adaptations.contact_adress: Nataniel Aguirre Street N° 560, City of Potosí - Bolivia
Adaptations.source: Small Grants Program (PPD) - United Nations Development Program (UNDP), www.pnud.bo/ppd/
Adaptations.executing_agent: NGO Tomás Katari Technical Institute (IPTK)
Adaptations.success_factors: Low level of knowledge about natural resources management and appropriate technologies for food security and nutritional education.
Adaptations.limiting_factors: Low level of awareness on the part of producers / farmers about the use of improved technologies in soil resources, water and plant.
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: Local staff raising awareness about the significance of local water harvesting means. Producers educated and trained in natural resource management, appropriate technologies in agricultural production and nutritional facts.

Adaptations.title: Communities of Guarani culture TCO Charagua northern of Chaco Boliviano with tools to adapt to climate change
Adaptations.description: The project aims to encourage Pocoata families to improve diversified agro-ecological production through proper management of natural resources and thus complement the diet.
Adaptations.contact_adress: Omiste street 116 1st floor, Llallagua - Bolivia
Adaptations.executing_agent: PRODII
Adaptations.success_factors: It requires the full participation of the Pocoata Municipality institution to ensure the sustainability of the measures.
Adaptations.limiting_factors: There are no certain limiting factors at the local level, affecting the implementation of the measures and make even more infeasible
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: The project will achieve a sustainable integrated management of haba bean crop through soil conservation practices. Productive community families will apply soil conservation practices, also the beneficiary families will have family micro-irrigation systems to increase crop yields.
Adaptations.comments: With training in efficient water management, soil conservation and improvement of productivity and adaptive measures will be adequate. The development of genetic material for the production fresh organic bean crop, as a form of adaptation.

Adaptations.title: Reforestation of the recharge zones of fresh water sources and recovery of agrobiodiversity of tubers and cereals
Adaptations.description: The project aims to protect freshwater sources through reforestation and recovery of native germplasm of agricultural biodiversity of cereals and tubers in the communities of the municipality of Colquechaca to ensure food security to people and to preserve the fertility of agricultural soils in a sustainable manner. For this purpose, it will be built and installed a forest nursery with a capacity of 10.000 production seedlings per year. Furthermore, it will be carried out the reforestation of 36 recharge zones of freshwater sources, with 12.000 forest species between native and exotic. The activities include an inventory and a registry of the agro-biodiversity of tubers and native cereals in different varieties.
Adaptations.contact_adress: Roberto Prudencio Street § 835 between 14th and 15th streets, Calacoto, La paz - Bolivia
Adaptations.source: Small Grants Program Organization - PPD (UNDP), http://sgp.undp.org/index.cfm
Adaptations.executing_agent: Project Concern International (PCI)
Adaptations.success_factors: Organization of communities, Colquechaca municipality together with the five sub municipalities should actively participate in the process of reforestation and improvement of agricultural soils
Adaptations.limiting_factors: The non-construction of the hatchery and / or poor availability of seedlings of species will complicate the protection measuresm water sources.
Adaptations.mitigation_synergies: The reforestation to protect freshwater sources contributes to mitigation through the capture of carbon from the atmosphere during the growth of forest trees.
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: Improvement of 38 hectares of agricultural soil with incorporation of leguminous green manure, crop rotation, application of reversible plows and agroforestry systems.
Adaptations.comments: The greates impact will be seen in the environmental field because the final purpose is to generate processes of adaptation to climate change, protecting thus the fresh water sources in the aquifer recharge areas of the five sub Mayorallty of Colquechaca. This will enable the recovering the agrobiodiversity of tubers, cereals and some native forest species to improve degraded soil fertility, eroded by monoculture systems and overgrazing.

Adaptations.title: Rescue and transfer of bioindicators of interandean valleys from a cultural context
Adaptations.description: The objective of the project is to promote the appreciation and use of ancestral knowledge on bioindicators, through the rescue, comparison and transfer of these practices as mechanisms of adaptation to climate change in the region of Illimani. This Knowledge is clearly related to self-protection of biodiversity articulated to irrigation. The assessment will provide knowledge and proven practices of Andean technology combined with current scientific technological progress. It proposes the comprehensive development of mountain ecosystems with high vulnerability to degradation of biodiversity, water and soil as well as the identification of vulnerabilities and mechanisms coping with climate change.
Adaptations.contact_adress: 6 de marzo avenue 4th street, No. 22, 3º floor, Bolivar “A”, El Alto city, La Paz - Bolivia
Adaptations.executing_agent: Revitalization of Ethnic Development and Andean Amazonian Biodiversity (Ayni Tambo)
Adaptations.success_factors: No preconditions for the measures introduced
Adaptations.limiting_factors: The ancestral bioindicators have uncertainty, so they must be validated through scientific basis for its implementation as adaptation measures.
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: Revaluation of ancestral knowledge, recovery of biodiversity, reforestation, water management and efficient use of irrigation, sustainable use of biological indicators. Generation of ancestral Bioindicators as a mechanism for adaptation to climate change. Systematization of bioindicators with testimony from local experts and technicians.
Adaptations.comments: In several cases it was shawn, that the community members base their crop and other production decisions on local knowledge system, developed over centuries of observation and experience. Therefore, this ancestral cultural capital should be categorized as basic strategies that can enhance the ability to adapt to the climate cycles and variabilities.

Adaptations.title: Assessment of regions affected by tropical glacier retreat
Adaptations.description: The project has two major components: research of Mururata retreat and evaluation of adaptation measures to climate change for planning, prioritization and implementation in the future. The project is developed in rural communities whose livelihood is mainly based on agricultural activities. It aims at developing of a strategy for climate change adaptation and establishing mechanisms trough agreements and dialogues for efficient use and management of water resources in regions affected by the retreat of glaciers. This should ensure the provision of urban drinking water without compromising surrounding rural production systems. The project focuces on a scientific research of Murata and Illimani glacier retreat and its influence on water availability in the Choquecota watershed through incorporating hydrometic stations for monitoring as well as on identifying of climate change impacts on natural and social systems through the work with community members.
Adaptations.contact_adress: Roberto Prudencio Street, 16th of Calacoto corner, Nº 8215 B, La Paz - Bolivia
Adaptations.initiating_agent: Project funded by the Embassy of Denmark. Prior approval
Adaptations.executing_agent: Technical equipment Sustainable Water NGO
Adaptations.funding_source: Project funded by the Embassy of Denmark
Adaptations.success_factors: Not appear during the implementation of the project, but institutional changes (municipality) can now perform critical situations for the implementation of measures.
Adaptations.limiting_factors: No single factor limiting the application of the adaptation strategy in place.
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: Baseline information about the case study related to climate change impacts as well as strategic document on climate change adaptation are developed. The communities of the Palca watershed were trained on the topic of climate change adaptation. Such training was participatory and proactive, as community members recognize the current and future effects of climate change and are able to propose solutions to the problem.
Adaptations.comments: Strengthening the ability to identify natural resource problems and involvement of community members in solving them.

Adaptations.title: Vulnerability of Andean Communities against climate change
Adaptations.description: The assessment had two general objectives: (1) Identify all the vulnerabilities of Agricultural Producers of the watershed study in terms of how they perceive their exposures, sensitivities and adaptive capacity to climate change and water problems induced by climate. (2) Understanding the role of an organization and its processes of decision making in relation to water stress and climate, including identificatory factors that facilitate or hinder adaptation to changing conditions and how they do it (past, present, future). The methodology was a qualitative, with descriptive and interpretive approach. Strategies for data collection included individual and group interviews and participatory strategies such as discussion groups, forums, workshops, seminars and consulting experts.
Adaptations.contact_adress: Roberto Prudencio Street,16 of Calacoto corner, Nº 8215 B, La Paz - Bolivia
Adaptations.initiating_agent: Project financed by IAI (Inter American Institute). Prior approval
Adaptations.executing_agent: Technical equipment NGO Sustainable Water
Adaptations.funding_source: Project financed by IAI (Inter American Institute).
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: The results demonstrate that the vulnerabilities of the agricultural sector in the three basins are heterogeneous, but share common themes closely linked to both climate scenarios and water availability as geographic location and topography of the communities (that determine the access or not to build artificial systems of irrigation water) and cultural resources and institutions that govern the use, access and distribution of water resources and soil. Adaptive capacities of the sector - despite facing significant challenges that are associated with climate scenarios predict further rise in average temperatures and decreased water availability - exhibit interesting social and cultural arrangements formal and informal.
Adaptations.comments: The research indicates that a higher level of development and more robust institutional frameworks, as in the cases of Argentina and Chile did not mean a greater capacity for climate adaptation in the case of Bolivia. Vulnerabilities to climate change and the resulting adaptations are mediated by processes dependent on socio-cultural context.

Adaptations.title: Strengthening the capacity and development of strategies for adapting to climate change phenomena in mountain communities
Adaptations.description: The project aims to build capacities and develop strategies to adapt to climate change impacts for the area of study, improvement of living conditions of vulnerable rural communities, the sustainability of rural production systems, drinking water supply systems and environment.
Adaptations.contact_adress: Roberto Prudencio street, 16th of Calacoto corner, Nº 8215 B, city of La Paz - Bolivia
Adaptations.initiating_agent: Project funded by IDRC- Canadá (International Development Research Centre). Prior approval.
Adaptations.executing_agent: Sustainable Water Technical Equipment, IHH and IIAREN
Adaptations.funding_source: Project funded by IDRC- Canadá (International Development Research Centre).
Adaptations.success_factors: Without the institutional cooperation of the municipality and the local community organization, hardly the diagnosis of the communities potentially affected by Illimani glacier retreat could have been done.
Adaptations.limiting_factors: Availability of resources after completion of the project to carry out adaptation strategies and actions in communities of Cordillera Real and Central of Los Andes in Bolivia.
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation:
"The project will identify adaptation measures related to the use and management of water resources in the Sajuaya watershed.
Communities take into account the issue of climate change and adaptation for development planning.
Technical- Ancestral Knowledge , now in implementation and validation process to replicate in other areas with similar geography and ecosystems."
Adaptations.comments: It builds a municipal model of Adaptation to Climate Change. Capacity, organizational and infrastructure building.

Adaptations.title: Adaptability of trees to climatic changes
Adaptations.description: Study of different types of trees in their behavior to climate changes.
Adaptations.contact_adress: 9th Km. north road Faculty of Agronomy UAGRM, city of Santa Cruz - Bolivia
Adaptations.executing_agent: Lars Markenstjein
Adaptations.success_factors: Environmental conditions affecting permanent sample plots in the Chiquitania.
Adaptations.limiting_factors: There were no factors affecting the implementation of the measures, meaning species that adapt to new climate conditions.
Adaptations.mitigation_synergies: The project is closely linked with the actions of mitigation from forestry sector.
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: Analysis of natural and planted trees artificially planted and with simulated drought. Species adapt to climate change.
Adaptations.comments: It has found that species are able to adapt to climate change.

Adaptations.title: Carbon fixation in forest management areas subject to different intensities of use and recovery areas
Adaptations.description: Establish the quantity of forests biomass and its sustainable management with areas recovery.
Adaptations.contact_adress: 9th km. north road of the Agronomy Faculty UAGRM, city of Santa Cruz - Bolivia
Adaptations.initiating_agent: Ministry of Development Planning - National Climate Change Program
Adaptations.executing_agent: Bolivian Institute of Forestry Research (IBIF)
Adaptations.success_factors: The project has been succesfully concluded.
Adaptations.mitigation_synergies: It features carbon fixation by the growth of species adapted to the changes of weather conditions.
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: The project presents species adapted to new weather conditions, with measurements of forest biomass and dry sub-humid.
Adaptations.comments: Research project on permanent sample plot.

Adaptations.title: Several Studies and Investigations
Adaptations.description: Study and adaptation of corn crops, tubers and other (all food)
Adaptations.contact_adress: Km. 7 1/2 north highway , Santa Cruz - Bolivia
Adaptations.executing_agent: Staff of the Agricultural Institute under the coordination of Ing. Espinoza
Adaptations.funding_source: Gabriel René Moreno University - Santa Cruz
Adaptations.success_factors: Low economic resources for the type of research.
Adaptations.limiting_factors: Water reduction, which could prevent the implementation and incorporation of resistant crops.
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: The project allows to obtain crops with greater resistance to drought and production of other traditional foods of the area.
Adaptations.comments: Founded crops can resist climate change, they have a better adaptation and ensure food security.

Adaptations.title: Water Management in Recovery and Maintenance of Vegas and Bofedales in Vegas and the Llama Breeding
Adaptations.description: Recovery and protection of ecosystems in two communities where llamas are bred to ensure their genetic quality, which are threatened by the effects of climate change, particularly drought.

Adaptations.source: Irish Catholic Agency for Development - Trocaire, www.trocaire.org
Adaptations.initiating_agent: Irish Catholic Agency for Development - Trocaire
Adaptations.executing_agent: Innovar foundation
Adaptations.funding_source: Irish Catholic Agency for Development -Trocaire and local counterparts
Adaptations.success_factors: Willingness of beneficiary communities and municipal authorities for the development of the projects activities.
Adaptations.limiting_factors: Increased levels of drought and reduced rainfall in Sud Lipez Province, Potosi.
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: The project will achieve the planting of traditional and new varieties of plants for the recovery of vegetation and the increase of forage in wetlands. Irrigation ditches will be construct for the recovery of soil and vegetation in meadows.
Adaptations.comments: Improvement of llamas breeding and monetary income to families dedicated to this activity.

Adaptations.title: Camelid sector development in the municipality of Batallas linked to the sustainable management of water resources and native prairie
Adaptations.description: Improved management of water resources and implementation of conservation practices for the improvement of natural grasslands in order to raise quality llamas.
Adaptations.contact_adress: Cañada Strongest Street Nº 1572,2nd. Floor Office 1,San Pedro, city of La Paz - Bolivia

Adaptations.executing_agent: NGO ADEMA
Adaptations.funding_source: Trocaire and Embassy of the Netherlands, through Nuevo Norte Foundation
Adaptations.success_factors: - Cooperation of local communities. - Financial resources availability.
Adaptations.limiting_factors: - Non-compliance of duties by the entity performing the project. - The presence of environmental conditions such as hail, high winds, disappearance of glaciers, new pests.
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: Generation capacity in farming families to develop adaptation measures to climate change through the improvement and conservation of native prairie and efficient use of water resources.
Adaptations.comments: Improved breeding of llamas and increased family income through the sale of quality wool.

Adaptations.title: Men and women deployed technologies against climate change - Huarina Model
Adaptations.description: Improved access to food through the implementation of basic technologies such as irrigation systems and soil management and promotion of an agro-ecological perspective.

Adaptations.limiting_factors: No limitations are foreseen for the implementation of the measures in the targeted communities.
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: "Irrigation systems, small reservoirs, terraces and other methods of soil management will be built; also will be promoted the use of natural fertilizers and introduction of greenhouses for growing vegetables."
Adaptations.comments: With actions it is intended to improve 30 % oflocal production

Adaptations.query: Santiago de Callapa Municipality, La Paz, Bolivia
Adaptations.title: Mechanisms of adaptation to climate change for agricultural production and vulnerabilities reduce in farming families in the municipalities of Calacoto, Santiago of Callapa and Ancoraimes
Adaptations.description: Strengthening local leaders in risk management issues and practices of incidence for emergency prevention and adaptation / mitigation against climate change.
Adaptations.contact_adress: Ecuador avenue Nº 2253, Sopocachi, city of La Paz - Bolivia
Adaptations.source: Irish Catholic Agency for Development - Trocaire, www.trocaire.org
Adaptations.executing_agent: NGO - Sucacollos Program (Prosuco)
Adaptations.funding_source: Trocaire, local counterpart and possibly COSUDE
Adaptations.success_factors: The lack of interest and participation to build a culture of prevention and mitigation by social and productive organizations and originary and municipal authoritiescan become a critical factor for the strengthening of local institutions.
Adaptations.limiting_factors: Changes in rainfall patterns, drought, periods of intense cold, pests can become limiting factors for adaptation actions with a focus on agro-ecological production systems.
Adaptations.mitigation_synergies: The project does not specify mitigation actions, but from a culture of prevention.
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: The project will promote areas of information, reflection and decision-making between social, productive organizations and municipal authorities to build a culture of prevention and mitigation by strengthening local institutions. Leaders also be developed with productive capacities to generate, adapt, validate and disseminate risk reduction measures and adaptation. Appropriate technologies will be implemented to adapt to climate change to reduce the vulnerability of production systems with agro-ecological approach
Adaptations.comments: Local actors will be articulated to an adaptation to climate change network to boost new strategies, mechanisms and measures to face new challenges.

Adaptations.title: Sustainable Management of Natural Resources
Adaptations.description:
"Support for families and small farmers to have sustainable agriculture as an strategy for adaptation and mitigation to climate change.
Therefore the project will:
- Build slow formation terraces
- Promote the use of organic fertilizers
- Diverse production
- Apply afforestation measures
- Construct dams and irrigation systems for growing vegetables
All these with a sustainable agricultural production focused on climate change, will be implemented together with the families of the municipality of Colquechaca, driven by their own decisions and support of their authorities and institutions."
Adaptations.contact_adress: Dalence No. 720 Sucre - Bolivia
Adaptations.source: Irish Catholic Agency for Development -Trocaire, www.trocaire.org
Adaptations.initiating_agent: Irish Catholic Agency for Development - Trocaire
Adaptations.executing_agent: ONG Tomás Katari Technical Institute (IPTK)
Adaptations.success_factors: Environmental factors such as hail and frost that may arise during the implementation of the project.
Adaptations.mitigation_synergies: Although it is mentioned in the project, there are no established mitigation actions yet.
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: The project is still under implementation.
Adaptations.comments: Have a look at another project from Trocaire: http://cigrasp.pik-potsdam.de/adaptations/152

Adaptations.title: Research - Action with adaptation measures to climate change
Adaptations.description: Research on climate change impacts and vulnerabilities at a household level (together with a practical intervention to be adapted at small scale) is a first step of an effective adaptation. The objective of this assessment is to strengthen the work of Trocaire (the official overseas development agency of the Catholic Church in Ireland) at the level of livelihood programs and the impact on the climate change issues. Strengthened family farming and less vulnerability to the effects of Climate Change will be the result.
Adaptations.contact_adress: 6 de marzo avenue Nº 888 between 6th and 7th streets, 12 de octubre zone, city of El Alto - Bolivia
Adaptations.source: Irish Catholic Agency for Development -Trocaire, www.trocaire.org
Adaptations.initiating_agent: Irish Catholic Agency for Development - Trocaire
Adaptations.executing_agent: NGO, Research and Production Center of Peasant (CIPCA) La Paz
Adaptations.success_factors: Institutional capacity for the process of afforestation and protection of water sources.
Adaptations.limiting_factors: Extremes of temperature, changes in precipitation patterns and wind patterns, increased frequency of extreme climatic events (frost, floods and droughts).
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: The project promotes the afforestation and protection of water sources, by valuing local knowledge. It sensitize the population and municipal government on the causes and effects of climatic changes and also investigate, along with selected families, vulnerabilities, adaptation measures and mitigation to climate change.
Adaptations.comments: Have a look at another project from Trocaire: http://cigrasp.pik-potsdam.de/adaptations/151

Adaptations.query: Esteban Arce Province, city of Cochabamba - Bolivia
Adaptations.title: Dam and irrigation system Ch’iyara Qhochi
Adaptations.description: The main components of this project are the construction of a community reservoir and the provision of an irrigation system. The reservoir has a capacity of 540,000 m3 to store rainwater during the months of October – March, which can be used from June – November. This reduces the vulnerability of the population to climate variability and climate change. The project will provide access to irrigation to secure and increase productivity, diversify production, with positive effects on diet and cash income. It also increases the available agricultural work and involvement throughout the year in reducing production’s migration. Beside the provison of reservoir and irrigation system, additionally technology to optimize spray irrigation was introduced.
Adaptations.contact_adress: Rosendo Gutierrez street Nº 704, Sopocachi, city of La Paz - Bolivia
Adaptations.executing_agent: Promoted by CIPCA, supervised by the municipal government of Sacabamba and built by community members
Adaptations.funding_source: Governments of Japan and Bolivia and private institutions for social development
Adaptations.success_factors: Secure financial resources for the maintenance of the dam by the municipal government Sacabamba for project sustainability.
Adaptations.limiting_factors: Regular weather conditions
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: The implementation of the irrigation system has improved the productivity, diversified the agricultural production and increased the monetary income and became thus a valuable tool for economic, environmental, technological and social development.
Adaptations.comments: The project comprises six components: 1. Infrastructure component 2. Irrigation management 3. Soil conservation in farmland 4. Management of watershed and non-agricultural land 5. Production Support 6. Strengthening the organization of the irrigation

Adaptations.query: Mojocoya, Zudáñez province, city of Chuquisaca - Bolivia
Adaptations.title: Construction and management of multipurpose lakes
Adaptations.description:
"The objective of the project is the preservation of water storage capacity of reservoirs, in order to ensure food security and income generation of small agricultural producers. This will be achieved through construction of lagoons for rain water harvesting and management, which will capture and store surface runoff water in the rainy season.
The stored water will be used during the dry season for domestic, mainly drinking and crop irrigation. This results to a reduced dependence on precipitation and its variability in time, distribution and quantity. Furthermore the project will reduce the accumulation of sediments in the lagoons through the implementation of biomechanical constructions and afforestation of infiltration trenches."
Adaptations.contact_adress: Rosendo Gutierrez street Nº 704, Sopocachi, City of La Paz - Bolivia
Adaptations.executing_agent: Rural community members and farmers organizations of the Municipality of Mojocoya
Adaptations.funding_source: Several state institutions (Rural Development Fund, Municipal Government of Mojocoya, Prefecture of Chuquisaca) and private (International Plan, ATICA and PROAGRO)
Adaptations.success_factors: Mojocoya Municipality and communities must ensure the maintenance of the lagoons to ensure resource sustainability and availability of water for consumption and for the irrigation systems in agricultural production.
Adaptations.limiting_factors: Regular weather conditions
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: "Forest plantations have been carried out around each lagoon; the volume of sediments deposited in lagoons is reduced; 34 families are capable to apply soil conservation techniques."
Adaptations.comments: The involvement of the beneficiary population is crucial in several instances such as in the implementation and social control of the project, planning of activities, meetings and workshops as well as in the monitoring and evaluation of the project.

Adaptations.title: Management and conservation of soils and degraded areas
Adaptations.description:
"The project aims a reduced degradation of the Andean, caused by anthropogenic use of watersheds and soil management (burning and logging) and surface irrigation on slopes.
Main activities are:
• Mechanical measures (bench terraces and slow formation)
• Vegetable measures (cover crops)
• Changes in irrigation method (a spray)"
Adaptations.contact_adress: Rosendo Gutierrez street Nº 704, Sopocachi, city of La Paz, Bolivia
Adaptations.source: Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (Cosude), www.cooperacion-suiza.admin.ch/bolivia/
Adaptations.initiating_agent: Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (Cosude)
Adaptations.executing_agent: Integrated Watershed Management Program (PROMIC)
Adaptations.funding_source: Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (Cosude)
Adaptations.success_factors: Mechanical support from the participating municipalities in the task of building terraces.
Adaptations.limiting_factors: Availability of native species for plantings and soil erosion prevention.
Adaptations.mitigation_synergies: The project has no actions related to mitigation.
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: Terraces and infiltration trenches were built. Planting of native vegetation was carried out to prevent erosion. Furthermore, the project introduced an organic matter to improve soil structure and fertility, such as retention of moisture in the soil. Sprinkler systems were installed too.

Adaptations.title: Water harvesting through the construction of water reservoirs

Adaptations.query: Coro Coro, Pacajes, La Paz, Bolivia

Adaptations.query: Santiago de Callapa, La Paz, Bolivia
Adaptations.title: Strengthening the management capacity of economic development
Adaptations.description: Integrated project that includes water harvesting, restoration of native grasslands, wire fences, use of groundwater and livestock activities

Adaptations.title: Gender and adaptation to climate change in watershed areas
Adaptations.description:
"The GTZ Project, PROAGRO, works in two communities, Kuyoj Qhocha and Tapera, where residents are largely dependent on irrigation-fed agriculture for their livelihoods. Changes in precipitation patterns and rising temperatures in both communities have already begun to impact agricultural outputs and family incomes.
In many instances, men have been forced to migrate away from their homes to seek work to supplement family incomes, placing an additional burden on women to care for the homes, children, livestock and family agricultural plots. As a response measure, PROAGRO has partnered with the GTZ’s Climate Protection Program to design an adaptation to climate change pilot project that targets the special needs of women in the two affected communities. The project seeks to stabilize livelihoods and diversify incomes, without increasing the work load for women. A further goal of the pilot is to increase awareness and improve information about climate change.
The pilot’s activities focus on capacity building, natural resource protection and production of new crop varieties. Weather stations have been installed in both communities to provide information about temperature and precipitation that can be communicated to the national meteorological service. Community members have participated in workshops to improve their knowledge about climate change. Trainings have been carried out to adapt forest, water and soil management practices to changing climatic conditions. New crop varieties have been introduced to diversify both family nutrition and incomes, as well as improve food security. In all cases, emphasis has been placed on giving women a leadership role in managing the new activities."
Adaptations.contact_adress: Sanchez Bustamante avenue Nº 509, between 11th and 12th streets of Calacoto, city of La Paz - Bolivia
Adaptations.source: Sustainable Agricultural Development Program - PROAGRO, www.proagro-bolivia.org
Adaptations.initiating_agent: PROAGRO in conjunction with regional governments of Cochabamba, Sacaba and Aiquile, authorities of watersheds Tapera and Kuyoq Qhocha
Adaptations.executing_agent: Womens groups supported by PROAGRO
Adaptations.funding_source: Government of Germany and the counterpart of women
Adaptations.success_factors: Permanent accomplishment of the project’s designed activities.
Adaptations.limiting_factors: Weak organization of women, extreme events, aspects of climate.
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: No regret
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: Initial results of the pilot point to improved understanding within the two communities with regard to climate change. Women have gained valuable experience in improving their family’s incomes via the production of flowers, berries, vegetables, eggs and fish, which can be used for the family’s consumption or sold in the local markets. The pilot has also introduced methods to improve soil-quality, concepts of land-use planning to maximize returns and irrigation technology to help use water more efficiently.

Adaptations.title: Community Reforestation
Adaptations.description: "The project aims to (i) control erosion and reduce the associated landslide and flood risks through the reforestation of erosion-prone areas of the city, particularly where favelas are located, and (ii) employ local residents and re-introduce native tree species to the hillsides. The individual reforestation projects are carried out on relatively small areas of land, ranging from plots of one hectare to larger parcels of 18 to 30 hectares. In each area to be reforested, the project is implemented undertaken in three stages 1. Site Selection based on social (community association in existence, community desire, viability, potential for favela expansion) and environmental (severity of slopes, presence of water sources and springs, drainage basin areas, size of site) criteria; 2. Site Preparation The site is cleared, drainage canals and roads built, and the soil plowed, with fertilizer made from composted municipal waste worked into the soil to improve nutrient content and overall soil quality. In areas with very steep slopes, terraces are built to stabilize the soil, increasing water retention and reducing erosion. At the same time, seedlings cultivated from a municipally-owned model farm forest nursery are selected by forest engineers to best suit the nature of the site being reforested. 3. Planting and Maintenance The prepared sites are planted using forest succession principles involving primary and secondary species.Resources required  labour, tools, tree seedlings"

Adaptations.funding_source: Municipality of the City of Rio de Janeiro (Brazil) funds the entire costs, including expenses for staff and for replanting
Adaptations.success_factors: The main preconditions are social (community association in existence, community desire, viability, potential for favela expansion) and environmental criteria (severity of slopes, presence of water sources and springs, drainage basin areas, size of site).
Adaptations.limiting_factors: the application of this measure mainly depend of the existence of a community association and the community desire.

Adaptations.title: Coastal Management
Adaptations.description: "The purpose of this technical cooperation is to establish a coastal zone management program for the area between Tamandaré (PE) and Paripueira (AL) which responds to the need of local fishermen and other stakeholders. The long-term aim is to enable rural communities along approximately 120 km of coast to improve their livelihood by opening new economic opportunities made possible through management of marine and coastal ecosystems and improved municipal land use planning. The specific objectives are: 1. build consensus on development policy or the coastal region by integrating the local entities responsible for land and marine resource management; 2.strengthen local coastal management capacity; 3. improve understanding of the effects of coastal development on the area’s marine ecosystems, particularly the coral reefs upon which artisanal fisheries and tourism depend; and 4. increase economic opportunities through the creation of employment alternatives in ecotourism, maintenance of fisheries yields and habitat conservation, and strengthened land use planning. "

Adaptations.title: Effective Conservation and Sustainable Use of Mangrove Ecosystems
Adaptations.description: The Objective is the conservation and sustainable use of mangrove ecosystems in Brazil to conserve globally significant biodiversity and key environmental services and functions important for national development and the well-being of traditional and marginalized coastal communities. The following Outputs are envisaged. OUTCOME 1: • Regulatory framework and corresponding operational guidelines developed for improved mangrove management. • Institutional procedures and capacities aligned to new regulatory framework for mangrove management and coordinated with sectoral policies. • Financial strategies for mangrove PA management tested and supported by the regulatory framework. • A representative network of mangrove UCs designed within the existing PA system. • National Plan for the Conservation and Sustainable Use of Mangroves designed and formalized. OUTCOME 2 • Resource management plan for fisheries developed at the ecosystem level in the UC cluster of Pará. • Resource management plan for the Uçá Crab developed and tested in the Parnaíba Delta. • Value-added mangrove products are identified and potential market opportunities are explored. • Capacity building program delivered to facilitate implementation and replication of sustainable use approaches to mangrove PA resources. OUTCOME 3 • Land planning guidelines tailored to mangrove conservation developed and tested in a large APA and coordinated with state and regional planning processes. • Water resources management processes developed and tested to include mangrove conservation needs. • Capacity building program designed and under implementation for relevant planning institutions, sectoral stakeholders and UC management.
Adaptations.contact_adress: Gerencia de Biodiversidade Aquatica,Esplanada dos Ministérios - Bloco B - 70068-900 - Brasília - DF , BRAZIL
Adaptations.executing_agent: UNDP and Ministry of Environment (Brazil)
Adaptations.funding_source: "Main: GEF Trust Fund; Cofinancing: Ministry of Environment, States Government, and Conservancy International "
Adaptations.success_factors: no information
Adaptations.limiting_factors: 1. Government commitment to improving mangrove conservation is not sustained thereby impeding uptake of new procedures and regulations into the existing framework. 2. The sub-optimal funding for effective management of Protected Areas (PA) will undermine the sustainability of improvements in PA effectiveness. 3. Key stakeholders do not maintain at least current levels of interest and willingness to work with Project actions.
Adaptations.mitigation_synergies: conservation and protection of natural resources reduce Gas emission.

Adaptations.title: Biodiversity and Watershed Conservation and Restoration
Adaptations.description: "The objective is to support the adoption of environmentally friendly land use practices on 3,400 hectares in two Atlantic forest watersheds in Espírito Santo State, thereby contributing to improved biodiversity conservation. The components of the project are: 1. Strengthening watershed management: the activities include (a) establish and strength watershed management committees, (b) prepare economic-ecological zoning plans, and (c) develop a communication strategy. 2. Biodiversity protection and protected area (PA) management: interventions to restore and enhance the protection of critical areas for biodiversity conservation, and support the Pedra Azul State Park, including the elaboration of management plans and assisting landowners in the creation of private nature reserves. 3. Integrating biodiversity in production landscapes. The component requires the adaptation of measures to (a) remove obstacles to the adoption of land use practices that would be beneficial both to farmers and the environment - inducing adoption of sustainable land use practices; and (b) stimulate the adoption of practices that generate positive externalities, particularly in biodiversity conservation and water services protection - establishing payments for environmental services."

Adaptations.title: Pernambuco Sustainable Water
Adaptations.description: "The development objective of the Sustainable Water Project is to improve sustainable water supply and sanitation services for the population residing in the Capibaribe river basin. This will result in a reduction in the percentage of served population subject to water rationing in the area and a reduction of pollution load discharged by the municipalities targeted by the project’s wastewater investments. This program focuses on four lines of action, as follows: (a) Consolidation and strengthening of the state’s institutional framework to adequately manage water resources; (b) Optimization of existing water infrastructure and increasing operational and financial efficiency of water supply and sanitation services; (c) Investment in expanding water supply and sanitation service coverage in urban areas; and (d) Designing and implementing adequate water and sanitation programs in rural communities and small towns using adequate technologies, financing and management frameworks."

Adaptations.title: Training Future Experts on Climate Change and Poverty
Adaptations.description: A gender balanced group of twenty local academic and non-academic researchers and key government officials will attend an intensive four week training course. After the course, four of the most qualified participants of the training course will conduct full-time research for six months. The research topics will cover climate risk management and poverty in communities in Aceh and contribute to the overall research theme. This thorough training will enable the researchers to provide information and policy advice on climate change and poverty to the local government, as well as map the future challenges of Aceh in relation to these issues.
Adaptations.contact_adress: Menara Thamrin Building, 8th Floor Jalan MH Thamrin Kav. 3, Jakarta 10250
Adaptations.executing_agent: UNDP and International Centre for Aceh and Indian Ocean Studies (ICAIOS)
Adaptations.mitigation_synergies: Nothing of both, but the project creates further possible measures and projects.
Adaptations.no_regret_win_win: Nothing of both, but the project creates further possible measures and projects.
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: The research will provide firsthand analysis of the current poverty situation and how the local population in Aceh experience climate risks and respond to these. At the end of the project the research results will be presented in a public seminar where key-stakeholders will be invited to discuss findings. The research results will further be published in a collection of articles. Finally, the project will result in a full size technical and financial proposal for a three year research training program on climate risk management and poverty in Indonesia.
Adaptations.comments: Better local knowledge about climate change and a better understanding of the impacts of climate change, included its relation to poverty, is essential in order to develop sustainable policies and reducing the region’s climate risks and vulnerability.

Adaptations.query: Phuoc Long , Bac Lieu, Viet Nam
Adaptations.title: Development of salinised and drought tolerant rice varieties
Adaptations.description: The project aims to minimize vulnerability and strengthening local adaptive capacity in order to reduce the impacts from droughts and salt water intrusion in rice production. The project will build a model for applying technological advances in conservation and sustainable use of local rice varieties which are tolerant to droughts and salinity. Therefore 100-105 ha of 2-3 drought and salinity tolerant rice varieties will be planted. 2-3 groups of farmers will be established, to meet the demand of the province and other neighboring provinces. Furthermore the project enhances the awareness and understanding of the local authorities and people on the impacts of climate change on socio-economic development. Therefore 10 technical training workshops and one study tour for the participating farmers will be organized.
Adaptations.contact_adress: 25-29 Phan Boi Chau Street, Hanoi, Viet Nam
Adaptations.executing_agent: SGP VIET NAM
Adaptations.success_factors: The project must be in line with the strategic directions of other agriculture- and socio-economic projects.
Adaptations.outcome_evaluation: The project enhances the capacity of rice farmers to cope better with the droughts and salt water intrusion as impacts of climate change. Income of rice farmers will be secured and increased by 10-12%. The rice varieties which are tested successfully will be promoted for wide application in the commune and other areas through the dissemination of the project technical document and availability of provision of seeds.
Adaptations.comments: The project will be undertaken in 3 villages of Phuoc Long commune with a focus on the model building while awareness raising activities will be conducted widely in the whole commune.

Adaptations.title: Promoting Resilient Coastal Development
Adaptations.description: This project will promote the development of adaptation options in coasts of Tunisia that are cross-sectoral, thereby breaking with the traditional, sectoral and infrastructure-heavy approaches of the past. The project will seek to demonstrate soft and innovative technologies to address the key coastal challenges (introducing vegetative buffers, wetland restorations, coastal dune stabilization and beach nourishment...), while building the capacity of local, regional and national stakeholders to undertake science-based adaptation planning. Financial mechanisms and risk sharing schemes will also be explored in order to internalize the costs of adaptation in the long term. Finally, the project will aim at generating a better understanding of climate impacts and adaptation options through targeted research, awareness raising, and knowledge sharing and dissemination
